oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Darel King
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Darel King, Capital District Library Council courier driver, is dressed all in blue and stands in front of the open door of the silver Capital District Library Council delivery van. oai_dc:dc.dc:title: First meeting minutes of the librarians of the Hudson-Adirondack region, 1964.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: First meeting minutes of librarians in the Hudson-Adirondack region of New York State held to discuss regional library cooperation. The meeting was held at Brubacher Hall, State University of New York at Albany (SUNY), two years before the Capital District Library Council received their provisional charter.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: unknown

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The Fourth R in the 3R's Program - A Talk, 1966.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The text of a talk given by Jean L. Connor at a meeting of the New York Metropolitan Reference and Research Library Agency in December of 1966. She outlines the evolution of the 3 R's councils from how they were conceived, to how they will be used and what will happen in the future.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Connor, Jean L.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Library cooperation; Libraries and state; Libraries -- New York (State)
